Nasceu sem querer na barra met√°lica vindo com os dejetos de passarinhos (veja a minha foto). As sementes passam inc√≥lumes pelo trato intestinal e s√£o depositadas a esmo pelas aves. Se ca√≠rem no alvo certo (um ramo de √°rvore) v√£o germinar. A pl√¢ntula cria haust√≥rios que v√£o fazer parte do hospedeiro e o h√≥spede vai fazer parte da planta numa esp√©cie de fus√£o numa troca unilateral de favores (parasitismo). No caso da barra de ferro evidentemente a muda vai se exaurir assim que acabarem as reservas de nutrientes da semente (o bulbinho). As ervas-de-passarinho tiram apenas a seiva bruta e fotossintetizam seu pr√≥prio alimento org√¢nico porque possuem clorofila (hemiparasitas), diferente dos holoparasitas totalmente dependentes do hospedeiro. "Nicandra Adans. Solanaceae
After the Greek botanist Nikander of Colophon (Nikandros
Kolophonios) (c. 100‚Äì150 A.D.), physician, poet, medical
writer, author of Alexipharmaca. Halae [Halle an der Saale]
1792 and Theriaca [and other works]. Venetiis 1522; see
Ernst H.F. Meyer (1791‚Äì1858), Geschichte der Botanik. I:
244‚Äì250. K√∂nigsberg 1854‚Äì1857.
Nicandra physalodes (L.) Gaertner (Atropa physalodes L.;
Boberella nicandra E.H.L. Krause; Nicandra minor Hort.
ex Fisch.; Nicandra physalodes Scop., nom. inval.; Physalis
daturaefolia Lam.; Physalodes peruviana Kuntze)
Central America, Peru. Annual herb, erect or low spreading,
heavily ribbed, smooth, succulent, stem yellow-green, leaves
alternate with irregularly deeply toothed margins, flowers
pale blue with white centre borne singly in axils of upper
leaves, corolla funnel-shaped, calyx winged and inflated, yellow
berry almost spherical, pitted seeds, damaged fruit with
smell of cooking oil, seed edible, tender leaves cooked and
used as a vegetable, weed, in wasteland, croplands, gardens
See Species Plantarum 1: 181‚Äì184. 1753, Familles des
Plantes 2: 219. 1763, Syst. Nat., ed. 12. 2: 171. 15‚Äì31 Oct
1767, Introd. Hist. Nat. 182. 1777, Encyclop√©die M√©thodique,
Botanique 2: 102. 1786, Genera Plantarum 124. 1789, De
Fructibus et Seminibus Plantarum‚Ä¶ . 2: 237, t. 131. f. 2.
1791, Index Seminum [St. Petersburg] 9: 81. 1843, Revisio
Generum Plantarum 2: 452. 1891 and Deutschlands Flora,
Abtheilung II, Cryptogamie 10: 54, 61. 1903, Field Mus.
Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser. 13(5B/1): 3‚Äì267. 1962, Fieldiana, Bot.
24(10/1‚Äì2): 1‚Äì151. 1974, Acta Phytotaxonomica Sinica 22:
243‚Äì249. 1984, Izvestiia Akademii Nauk Belorusskoi SSR:
Seriia Biologicheskikh Nauk 6: 3‚Äì8. 1985, Cytologia 51:
319‚Äì324. 1986, Botaniƒçeskij ≈Ωurnal (Moscow & Leningrad)
80(2): 87‚Äì90. 1995, Opera Botanica 137: 1‚Äì42. 1999
(Toxic, caution. Whole plant used as a diuretic, a sedative
and cough remedy; leaf decoction to destroy head lice; leaf
juice given in amebic dysentery. Seeds insecticide and febrifuge,
boiled with water and taken for fever, indigestion and
constipation.)
in English: apple of Peru, Chinese lantern, shoo fly, shoo fly
plant, shoofly plant
in Peru: anrreshuailla, capuli cimarr√≥n, ccarapamacmam,
corneta jacha, joto-joto, jarrito, orzita de pellejo, toccoro
in East Africa: chemogong'it-cheptitet
in Madagascar: boreda, gaboroda, tsipokipoky, tsitsipoky in South Africa: basterappelliefie, bloubitterappelliefie, bloubitter,
wildebitter

nyasongwe, oldule, ormunaanaa
in China: jia suan jiang
in India: bandoola gida, endu, kunni, neeleebuddegida, rasbhari,

"no sorry - this is Annona coriacea Mart.
the pedicel is long and hairy
the outer petals are almost equally thick from base to the tip
the inner petals are imbricate, and the leaves have a very pronounced shiny margin 
 
in Annona crassiflora 
flowers are almost sessile,
the outer petals are very thick apically
inner petals are valvate
leaves are much thinner and lack the translucent margin"

"NOMENCLATURA E SIGNIFICADO: SARAGUAJ√ç vem do Tupi-Guarani e significa ""Fruta igual a olho de Araguai"" ou ""Olhem os Aragua√≠s"" o nome √© bem apropriado pois segundo alguns mateiros que consultei, o Aragua√≠ ou Periquit√£o-maracan√£ (Aratinga leucophthalmus) se alimenta dos frutos dessa planta e os √≠ndios que ca√ßavam esse p√°ssaro para usar as belas penas em seus adornos, associaram a presen√ßa dessas aves na arvore, comendo os frutos. Origem: Ocorre com certa raridade em terrenos pedregosos e com umidade natural e forma√ß√µes novas da Floresta atl√¢ntica, e floresta semidecidua da bacia do Paran√°; desde o estado de Pernambuco at√© o Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil. Caracter√≠sticas: Arvore caducif√≥lia (que perde as folhas no inverno), com at√© 4 a 6 m de altura em terrenos pedregosos, chegando a atingir 15 a 20 m no interior da floresta com tronco de 30 a 40 cm de di√¢metro, com colora√ß√£o avermelhada. Dicas para cultivo: Arvore de crescimento r√°pido que resiste a baixas temperaturas (at√© -3 graus), vegeta bem em qualquer altitude. "Noni juice (Morinda citrifolia ): Hidden potential for hyperkalemia? https://www.sciencedirect.com/.../pii/S0272638600703428 The usual recommended dose of noni juice
found on the World Wide Web sites dedicated to
noni juice is 1 oz/d, the same listed on the bottle
of noni juice used in the analysis. This small
volume of noni juice would result in the intake of
only 1.66 mEq/d of potassium. However, many
of the testimonials published on these same web
sites recommend far greater doses. Given that the
potassium content of noni juice is 56.3 mEq/L,
patients with renal dysfunction taking large volumes
of noni juice may be at risk for the development
of hyperkalemia. Patients with kidney disease
and unexplained hyperkalemia should
be queried about their ingestion of herbal remedies
and alternative medicine products because
they may be a hidden dietary source of potassium"

S√£o descritas 3 esp√©cies novas: Swartzia alternifoliolata, Swartzia capixaba e Zollernia scorpioides e s√£o propostas 2 combina√ß√µes novas: Swartzia submarginata e Swartzia submarginata var. leiogyna Swartzia acutifolia var. ynesiana foi sinonimizada com Swartzia oblata, Swartzia grazielana com Swartzia macrostachya e Swartzia apetala var. blanchetii e Swartzia apetala var. subcordata foram sinonimizadas com Swartzia apetala var. apetala Zollernia magnifica e Zollernia modesta, referidas apenas para a Bahia, foram citadas pela primeira vez para a regi√£o Sudeste. O mamoeiro possui essencialmente tr√™s tipos de flores, as quais originam plantas do sexo masculino, feminino e hermafrodita.
